result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett William Stieve was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment if not done within the last 12 months and to comply with any recommended treatment.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Apology letter to the Victim, submit to Agent and Agent will provide to victim.
  Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  B.Tepp and R. Aisbet  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
Early discharge after 24 months if successful and is recommended by Agent.
AODA if not had one within the last 12 months & comply with treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: All Fines/costs in this case are paid in full.

records.addlTxt: /Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation /s/ RJS 08/23/17

Defendant Brett William Stieve in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt.  DA Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended cts 3 & 4 State adds domestic abuse modifiers. An Amended Information will be filed with the Clerk after court. Parties agree and waive reading of the amended information.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Victim was notified and is not present today.
Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 2: No Contest
Amended Ct 3: No Contest
Amended Ct 4: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Ct 2, Amended Cts 3 & 4.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 1 dimissed and read in.

DA Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland concurs in part but requests no jail time.
Defendant makes apologetic statements. 

BY THE COURT:**PROBATION**
Count 2: 
W/H Sentence 36 months Probation
Pay costs & surcharges including DNA & Domestic.
Concitions:
AODA if not had one within the last 12 months & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment if not done within the last 12 months and to comply with any recommended treatment.
  Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Apology letter to the Victim, submit to Agent and Agent will provide to victim.
  Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  B.Tepp and R. Aisbet  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
Early discharge after 24 months if sucessful and is recommended by Agent.

Count 3: 
W/H Sentence 36 months Probation, concurrent with Count 2
30 days jail, concurrent with Count 4 - with Huber, if eligible, entire jail sentence can be served on electronic monitor, Report today to get start date. To be served within 60 days.
Pay costs & surcharges including DNA & Domestic. 2 days credit.
Concitions:
Same conditions as stated in Count 2.

Count 4: 
W/H Sentence 36 months Probation, concurrent with Count 2 & 3
60 days jail, concurrent with Count 3 - - with Huber, if eligible entire jail sentence can be served on electronic monitor, Report today to get start date. To be served within 60 days.
Pay costs & surcharges including DNA & Domestic.
Concitions:
Same conditions as stated in Count 2.

Bond on file to be applied.
